name: Theory of Structures I
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 221-0-01 Theory of Structures I

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Deflections of structures, energy concepts, idealization of structures, truss analysis, column stability, and influence lines. Introduction to indeterminate truss and frame analyses, slope-deflection analysis, and moment distribution. Portal method

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
1. Classify if a structure is determinate or indeterminate
2. Differentiate a plane truss from a plane rigid frame structure
3. Analyze determinate and indeterminate plane trusses and plane rigid frames
4. Determine the deflection of a structure under load (forces and other types) ? both plane rigid frames and
plane trusses using virtual work
5. Analyze a structure using consistent displacement method, slope deflection, and moment distribution method
6. Use Excel proficiently as a calculation tool for the analyses discussed in the course
7. Analyze a structure using commercial computer software
8. Determine the maximum design force using influence lines
9. Determine stability (buckling load capacity) of axial members
10. Experimental stress analysis of beams and frame

descriptions.value:
